childnodes.sy: Exceptional espresso means Peregrine is always packed, so come on a weekday if you can. Always ask for the special, which is sure to be amazing.

The world’s best chocolate chip cookie goes even better with a terrific cup of coffee at Blind Dog Café. Be bold and order the off-the-menu espresso soda for something unique, delicious and refreshing.

What’s that adorable coffeehouse around the corner? It’s La Colombe, where they serve a terrific iced coffee with a shot of espresso that goes great with any of their yummy baked goods. They even offer tasting classes on Fridays.

Whether you’re in the mood for pork buns, ramen, draft beer or single origin coffee, Dooby’s has you covered. No matter what you order, try paring a chocolate budino with a Colombian pour-over for dessert.
Whether you’re in the mood for a simple harvest blend coffee or something sweeter like a salted caramel custard latte, Ebenezers delivers with top-notch coffee and an awesome atmosphere.

Located above Union Market, Dolcezza serves amazingly fresh, handcrafted, small batch gelato – try the hazelnut and vanilla bean flavors – along with gorgeous pastries and a rotating roster of Stumptown coffees.
childnodes.t: 2. Dolcezza Gelato Factory And Coffee Lab

childnodes.sy: Tryst is a coffee house, cafe and a full bar rolled up into one cozy package, so you really can have it all here -- from a latte and apple pie to a beer and nachos.
childnodes.t: 3. Washington, D.C. Perk Up Coffee Spots

childnodes.sy: Little Red Fox may be best known for their yummy sandwiches, but the breakfast burrito with eggs, bacon, avocado, beans, cheddar and corn really stands out, as well.
